title: League of Legends: Leaverbuster system/cultural punishment of noobs
body:
Yeah sorry, just a quick rant on the LeaverBuster system and some issues I have seen with the culture of the game surrounding new players.
I think its a real pity with such a good concept League of Legends has seriously underwhelmed me with some aspects of the game they employ, including the LeaverBuster system and its lack of acknowledgement of the real world, I think its a very good idea that has been taken to with an utter militancy that leaves me wondering why I'm waiting an entire hour over 5 games to play a game that has such a toxic culture, and has no option to appeal to Riot for getting punished over something that in real life, you had no control over!!! (Family emergency's, power outages, ect)
If I could make a suggestion, lower the wait time to 10 mins per game, because to be quite frank, 1/3 of an hour for one game is a bloody joke!!!

NEVER!!! In my 18 years of gaming experience have I witnessed a game with such a disgraceful treatment of new players, punishing players who feed is something completely different to those who are new, and a line needs to be drawn in regards to this. I think it is totally Riots responsibility that if they want their game to expand that they create an environment that has the capacity to assist newer players, and the Honouring system, straight up doesn't cut it! As the environment I am currently witnessing has me wondering why I should invest the time to learn the game and perform better if people are going to bully and report me for having a bad game

Currently I'm seriously struggling with this game, I have spent the past six months or so playing League, and have spent much and more on this, and I think it's seriously disheartening that such a good game can have such a poor delivery!!! 5/10 atm

Come on Riot, Cut us newbs some slack!!!

replies.body:
Looks like this rant is based off your inexperience in League of Legends.
Low Priority Queue times only apply to those who AFK very often, like what Knuuckles said above (I for one will admit, I happen to fall under this category too often so I know all about Low Priority Queue). 20 minutes is the average wait time, there are other instances where some people may get 10 minutes and others even a whole 40 minutes of wait time. But then again, this information may be outdated, last time I heard someone with 40 minutes was a while ago, perhaps they changed everything to 20 minutes.

But the point of this 20 minute wait is for you to really improve your time organization, for you to plan ahead. Something like a one day ban wouldn't stop someone from not AFKing the next time if they're caught in the same situation that made them AFK before. But if they were to theoretically 'drag' the 'game time longer' than one will have to start investing in time organization.

League of Legends isn't the only game that punishes you for AFKing, in fact most if not all MOBAs and other multiplayer online strategy games do, so I don't see why you're singling out League of Legends. So yes, it is Riot's responsibility to assist new players, but just because you are a new player, that doesn't mean you have technical leeways, only in-game mechanical leeways (and even that itself is limited to gamemode).

Perhaps you're getting a little ahead of yourself by posting your thoughts that have been clouded with frustration, but ultimately, a game like League of Legends can't really function well if it were to be full with gamers who cannot afford to game without needing to AFK. For a period of time, my time was very unpredictable, and I knew I won't be able to play League of Legends at all since I only have small unpredictable windows of time to game at all, and thus I temporarily hopped onto DOTA 2 since there is a solo mode that I can pause anytime I want. This is different in League since even in a custom game you can't pause even if you're the only player in the game.

Ultimately, if you're also dealing with issues that split your game time, you really shouldn't be playing League of Legends. I'm not saying that you should go over to DOTA 2 or not, but if you do want to play a great MOBA that can be paused, then you should hop on over there. Personally I am a casual player so I can just chill in DOTA 2's solo bot games, but that way I won't be affecting the League of Legends community by AFKing randomly all over the place as well as exploring diversity in gaming.

Even if it means giving new players a 5 minute queue every time they AFK for their first month, it's still something.

I'm not in your situation, but I understand.
When you queue for a game, you expect all 9 other players to be there for the duration of the game.
Anything else is unacceptable.

Players that leave, deserve to be punished. You get one free pass a day, how is that not enough?

Like, for example, today I was playing an ARAM as {{champion:16}} , and built full healbot. My team was constantly running away from me while I was trying to heal them, tower diving on 1/4 life instead of letting me heal them up first, etc. I did everything I could to be a good healbot, but they still denied me heals, etc. I rage quit. They lost.

Should I be punished for trying to be a 100% support character to a team that makes it hard for me to support them? I ragequit because I was 100% support in an ARAM, and my team didn't respect that. Fuck them, I DC'd.

They lost, I was glad.

Normally, I would always see a game through. I am the very definition of a team player and anyone should be happy to be queued with me.
